Shopify will be able to grow its revenue at a “much faster rate” than its operating expenses for the foreseeable future, which will result in operating and free cash flow margin expansion and a higher v

headline: Loop Capital Upgrades Shopify (SHOP)
Why one analyst says Shopify is a buy over its AI use
summary: Loop Capital Markets gets bullish on Shopify (SHOP), upgrading the stock to a Buy and lifting its price target on the e-commerce company.  Loop Capital Markets Managing Director Anthony Chukumba tells Market Domination's Julie Hyman and Josh Lipto that Shopify’s internal use of AI is helping with efficiency and "keeping their expense base pretty stable." Chukumba adds that Shopify has become “even more attractive” to enterprise merchants. However, the smaller businesses Shopify represents still faces hefty competition from retail giants such as Walmart (WMT), with Chukumba believing the big-box retailer to be “hitting on all cylinders in a way we haven't seen for some time.” To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: How to play the software sector in AI age: Adobe, Oracle, Salesforce
summary: Ahead of Adobe (ADBE) and Oracle (ORCL) reporting earnings, BNP Paribas Exane global head of software research Stefan Slowinski joins Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton on Market Domination to discuss his strategy for navigating software stocks in 2025, which he expects to be the year of artificial intelligence (AI) agents. Slowinski says the software sector has made a "180-degree turn" in the last six months of 2024, with a "turn in sentiment" that "AI agents are finally the killer app that allows companies to monetize Gen AI." Among the software players, Slowinski names Salesforce (CRM) and Oracle (ORCL) as stocks still trading at "reasonable" valuations that are positioned to gain from the adoptions of AI agents and copilots. On the other hand, Adobe (ADBE) is one he has worries about. "Part of our concern around Adobe is just the increasing competition from the hyperscalers," like Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL), Meta (META), Amazon (AMZN), and Microsoft (MSFT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: A 'new golden age of retail' is emerging: Shopify President
summary: Shopify (SHOP) President Harley Finkelstein joined Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton to discuss the holiday shopping season and Shopify's role in empowering merchants. Finkelstein highlighted two key factors driving record holiday sales. First, he notes the extended shopping period: "We've expanded from being four days or six days to" approximately three months, with deals expected to continue through Christmas. Second, he emphasizes the evolution of retail across multiple online and offline channels, particularly through social media advertising, declaring, "It really does feel like this is a new golden age of retail." Regarding consumer spending, Finkelstein reveals that the average cart value in the United States this season is $154. Popular brands driving holiday sales include Cozy Earth, Brooklinen, Calpak, and Lola Blankets. He also noted the rising trend in subscription boxes, observing that "there's a lot more energy around these consumers buying directly from the brands that they love." The growth of social commerce is particularly noteworthy. Finkelstein reports that 57% of consumers aged 18-24 make purchases through Instagram, while 56% buy via TikTok. "It feels like it's more than just a transaction, it feels like this immersive gamified experience and it's making commerce and retail very exciting again," he told Yahoo Finance. Finkelstein emphasized Shopify's commitment to helping businesses expand globally, supporting everyone from first-time sellers to established household brands. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here. This post was written by Angel Smith
